communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Public Records Law, G.L., c. 66, § 10, I hereby request the following records:

all data, including statistical information, collected from any Massachusetts Uniform Citation (“MUC”) issued in the Commonwealth between January 1, 2021 and May 2024.

Some important fields may include: 

City of Boston Employee ID (6 digit ID)
Employee first name
Employee last name
Employee middle name
Badge Number
Rank
District/Taskforce
Date of Stop
Time of Stop
Location of stop
Latitude/longitude
Race of driver
Gender of driver
Age of driver
If search occurred
If contraband was found,

I also request a waiver of all fees for this request, as disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest and will contribute to the public’s understanding of operations and activities of the government. This request is being made for research conducted by Spark! at Boston University and will not be used for commercial use.

I expect the request to be filled in an electronically-accessible format, including for screen readers, excel, or CSV. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. We understand that the data may be large in size, so feel free to send it over in year or half-year increments.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. If you believe any of this information to be exempt, I ask you to please cite the specific portion of the law on which you rely. I also ask you to please redact any information you believe to be exempt and disclose the rest. If you need to discuss this request, I can be reached at 617-358-8514.

Sincerely,
Boston University SPARK!

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Montgomery County Jail Facility to please provide e-mail copies of any and all internal correspondence, e-mail, memos and texts using key words “Vipin Shah”.  The date range for this request is January 1, 2016  through December 31, 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcia Louise Morris

title: TSDB - Denied Boardings and Private Companies

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

5 Sept 2024

FBI – FOIA Request 
935 Pennsylvania Avenue NW
Washington, D.C.,  20535

Dear Sirs:
This letter constitutes a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, on behalf of Targeted Justice Inc.  This request is about the FBI's Terrorist Screening Center data.
1. Provide documents that show the number of times a TSDB listed person was denied boarding of an aircraft, in the United States.   Provide documents that show the trend over a number of years, up to 2023.
2. Provide documents that list the private companies, government organizations, and NGO's that receive the TSDB through the NCIC as of 2023.
3. Provide documents that show the distribution list for Fusion Centers, Police Depts, and Sheriff's Depts in the United States, as of 2023.

The term “document” is to be liberally construed to include any file, paper, microfilm, digital archive, or any other format where the information sought may be stored. The term “document” includes both the principal document responsive to the request as well as any studies, exhibits, supporting documentation or supplement thereof.

As you know, FOIA requires agencies to release information unless it is specifically exempt from disclosure, and also requires agencies to release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of documents, i.e., to redact exempt portions of documents and release the rest. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(8).
Targeted Justice's status as a news organization that provides information of public interest to its members warrants the expedited processing of this Request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed by an organization primarily engaged in disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2); 28 C.F.R. § n16.5(d)(1)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

Request for expedited processing
Targeted Justice currently has over 16,000 subscribers and over 110,000 thousand views a month in its Substack newsletter. Thus, pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466 it is a news media organization.
Targeted Justice also requests the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that the records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence.” Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity” See 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2)(i); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii)(A); see also 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(d)(1)(iv); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).
In light of the above, Targeted Justice requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.

Request for Fee Waiver
Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2).

Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as Targeted Justice will report the results of this endeavor on the grounds that Targeted Justice qualifies as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).

For any document you fail to produce, Targeted Justice requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

If you need to discuss this request, the undersigned can be reached at 713-306-8287. I will appreciate your prompt processing of this request as mandated by the FOIA.

Sincerely,
Winter Owen Calvert
Member, Board of Directors
Targeted Justice, Inc.
P.O. Box 15990
Houston, TX 77220

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Winter Calvert

communications.subject: Fwd: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew Urquhart:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email to
foia@nara.gov. We received your request on September 5, 2024.  Your request
states:

*I am looking for the naval service record of Alexander Wolseley Urquhart,
Jr. He was a navy pilot in World War 2.*

Due to the nature of your inquiry, we are forwarding your request by this
email to the National Personnel Records Center (NPRC) for Military Records
in St. Louis for appropriate handling.  The NPRC will assign your request a
tracking number and respond directly to you.  In the future, if you need to
contact the NPRC, you can do so by mail or fax to the following address:

National Personnel Records Center
1 Archives Drive
St. Louis, Missouri 63138

Telephone:   314-801-0800
Telephone (Toll Free):  1-866-272-6272 (only within the US)
Fax:  314-801-9195

For your reference, below you will find your original submission.

On our website at https://www.archives.gov/veterans/military-service-records
you can find information about requesting Official Military Personnel Files
(OMPFs) that are not yet archival records fully open to the public.  At the
website for the National Archives at St. Louis,
https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/ <https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/%20>,
you will find information about requesting Official Military Personnel
Files that are now archival records open to the public.  The OMPF normally
becomes an archival record 62 years after the date of discharge.

At www.archives.gov/foia <http://www.archives.gov/foia%20> we provide
information about FOIA.  On our home page, www.archives.gov, you can learn
about the resources that we offer to the public, and access our online
catalog.

Sincerely,

<https://www.archives.gov/>

  Ashley Bryan

  Government Information Specialist

  Operational FOIA and Access Division

  College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001

  301-837-3642

   <https://www.archives.gov/foia>   <foia@nara.gov>
<https://www.archives.gov/foia/contacts>
<https://www.archives.gov/foia/electronic-reading-room>
<https://www.archives.gov/ogis/resources>

From: <172926-53967958@requests.muckrock.com>
Date: Thu, Sep 5, 2024 at 3:24 PM
Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
To: <foia@nara.gov>



Nat'l Archives & Records Admin
FOIA Office
Room 3110
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, MD 20740

September 5, 2024

Dear Sirs:
This letter constitutes a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, on behalf of Targeted Justice Inc.  This request is about the FBI's Terrorists Screening Center data.
1. Provide documents that show a list of the countries that the TSDB is distributed to, as of 2023.  Also provide the contact organization in the country.
2.  Provide documents that show the graphical trend of numbers added to the TSDB since 2003.
3.  Provide documents that show the monthly reports of "encounters" in the United States for the last 5 years. “Encounters” means that a listed TSDB name is encountered by police or sheriff's dept in the United States.

The term “document” is to be liberally construed to include any file, paper, microfilm, digital archive, or any other format where the information sought may be stored. The term “document” includes both the principal document responsive to the request as well as any studies, exhibits, supporting documentation or supplement thereof.
As you know, FOIA requires agencies to release information unless it is specifically exempt from disclosure, and also requires agencies to release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of documents, i.e., to redact exempt portions of documents and release the rest. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(8).

Targeted Justice's status as a news organization that provides information of public interest to its members warrants the expedited processing of this Request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed by an organization primarily engaged in disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2); 28 C.F.R. § n16.5(d)(1)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

Request for expedited processing
Targeted Justice currently has over 16,000 subscribers and over 110,000 thousand views a month in its Substack newsletter. Thus, pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466 it is a news media organization.
Targeted Justice also requests the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that the records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence.” Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity” See 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2)(i); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii)(A); see also 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(d)(1)(iv); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).
In light of the above, Targeted Justice requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.

Request for Fee Waiver
Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2).
Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as Targeted Justice will report the results of this endeavor on the grounds that Targeted Justice qualifies as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).

For any document you fail to produce, Targeted Justice requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

If you need to discuss this request, the undersigned can be reached at 713-306-8287. I will appreciate your prompt processing of this request as mandated by the FOIA.

Sincerely,
Winter Owen Calvert
Member, Board of Directors
Targeted Justice, Inc.
P.O. Box 15990
Houston, TX 77220

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Winter Calvert

title: ArtCarve and other business dealing reports

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: ArtCarve and other business dealing reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act this request is for all documents and/or records involving any communications, procurements, and/or any other actions involving any member of the Virginia Military Institute Faculty, staff, administration, employee, cadet, organization (including Cadet Clubs) on any subject with the companies known as ArtCarved, Balfour, Herff Jones, or Jostens for the period 1 August 2023 to the date of this FOIA.

For the purpose of this request, “Documents and/or Records” is defined as “Any public record subject to disclosure under the Va. FOIA including any writing or recording, paper record, electronic file, audio, video recording, or any other format. This term shall mean all relevant data and information in the Custodian’s possession defined in [a] Requester’s General Subject of Inquiry and [b] Specific Subjects of Inquiry including but not limited to letters, notes, drafts, legal instruments, contracts, telephone transcripts, email correspondence, drawings and tables. Includes, without limitation, any and all forms of memorialized information, whether written, graphic, computerized, or stored electronically or on tape.  This definition specifically includes, but is not limited to, drafts, originals, copies, handwritten notes or comments, letters, correspondence, e-mails, records of discussions, memoranda, telegrams, telephone logs and records, teletypes, appointment books, meeting agenda or minutes, reports, briefings, presentations, studies, analyses, communications with government bodies, interoffice and intra-office communications with any party whatsoever, computer programs and printouts, social media communications, including, but not limited, to FaceTime, Instagram, FaceBook.com, text messages, and other records or voice records, films or tapes As well as any screenshots or other record showing calls of which there are no other records were made.”

For the purposed of this FOIA documents involving cadets and their activities related to these companies are not student records as defined by FERPA and, therefore, cannot be withheld.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jackson Death site
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act I am requesting copies of the following records for the period 1 January 2022 to the date of this request:

All documents and/or records, including, without limitation communications by any means, as defined in section I (above) pertaining to the actions considered, planned and/or initiated to remove or alter the site, and/or the contents therein as well as any actions to contextualize or otherwise comment on the General Jackson or his life.

In recent actions, the Parks Service placed hand written and other signs on the property pertaining to General Jackson and his legacy. The records show show what initiated this action, who initiated and/or directed this action, the associated decision-making process, directives, desired outcomes, plans, etc.

For the purpose of this request, Documents and/or Records are defined as any public record subject to disclosure under the Va. FOIA including any writing or recording, paper record, electronic file, audio, video recording, or any other format. This term shall mean all relevant data and information in the Custodian’s possession defined in [a] Requester’s General Subject of Inquiry and [b] Specific Subjects of Inquiry including but not limited to letters, notes, drafts, legal instruments, contracts, telephone transcripts, email correspondence, drawings and tables. Includes, without limitation, any and all forms of memorialized information, whether written, graphic, computerized, or stored electronically or on tape.  This definition specifically includes, but is not limited to, drafts, originals, copies, handwritten notes or comments, letters, correspondence, e-mails, records of discussions, memoranda, telegrams, telephone logs and records, teletypes, appointment books, meeting agenda or minutes, reports, briefings, presentations, studies, analyses, communications with government bodies, interoffice and intra-office communications with any party whatsoever, computer programs and printouts, social media communications, including, but not limited, to FaceTime, Instagram, FaceBook.com, text messages, and other records or voice records, films or tapes As well as any screenshots or other record showing calls of which there are no other records were made.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Morris

title: Obama Library: WHTV Tapes of October 21st 2010 visit to Seattle

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Obama Library: WHTV Tapes of October 21st 2010 visit to Seattle
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

White House Communications Agency video footage (WHTV content) filmed during President Obama's visit to Seattle on October 21st of 2010.

This is a request to review all footage from that day, including outtakes and rushes.

The itinerary for that day is described as followed:

Arrival at Boeing Field in Seattle
The President Meets With Seattle Family  (location: private residence)
The President Holds a Discussion on Women and the economy (location: private residence)
The President Delivers Remarks at a rally for Senator Murray (UW campus)
Departure from Seattle to San Francisco 

Of particular interest (to me) is of any video from the remarks by Obama given to the overflow crowd that gathered in the Husky Stadium end zone. I was on the rope line, and shook Obama's hand, at the overflow event that day: https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/the-press-office/2010/10/21/remarks-president-overflow-crowd-university-washington

It would be wonderful if these could be uploaded to the Obama Presidential Library YouTube page: https://www.youtube.com/@obamalibrary - As other similar requests have been.

Thank you for the Obama Presidential Library's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to the resolution of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: JCS's Strategic Planning Seminar
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

JCS's Strategic Planning Seminar 17-21 April 1972, Vol. I and II as described in the following link.

https://www.cia.gov/resources/csi/static/Deception.pdf
In April 1972, the Joint Chiefs of Staff sponsored a week-long Strategic 
Planning Seminar concentrating on the question of deception. Seminar 
presentations by participating U.S. Government departments and 
agencies, and by the Syracuse University Research Corporation (SURC) 
under contract to the Advanced Research Projects Agency, have been 
summarized in JCS's Strategic Planning Seminar 17-21 April 1972, Vol. I 
(SECRET/NO FOREIGN DISSEM). They appear in full in a 525-page 
Volume II which is TOP SECRET/ NO FOREIGN DISSEM.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Brian Mills

title: FBI: Sexologist Li Shiu Tong (李兆堂)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Sexologist Li Shiu Tong (李兆堂)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau records related to the sexologist Li Shiu Tong (李兆堂) born: January 9th 1907 - died: October 5th 1993). Li Shiu Tong was an LGBTQ activist in the early 20th century. Li Shiu Tong was a companion of a Jewish German sexologist named Magnus Hirschfeld who was forced into exile by the Nazis. 

Li Shiu Tong's colorful life and death in obscurity have been described in numerous articles online, such as this one:

https://theconversation.com/the-asian-canadian-gay-activist-whose-theories-on-sexuality-were-decades-ahead-of-their-time-180834

In the 1940s, Li Shiu Tong enrolled at Harvard University and reportedly began engaging in gay rights advocacy. From the 1940s to 1974 he repeatedly entered the United States and enrolled in various universities. From 1974 until his death in 1993 Li Shiu Tong was a resident of Vancouver, Canada. It would logical to assume that a Chinese academic advocating for gay rights from the 1940s to the 1970s caught the bureau's attention. 

This request is for any and all records about the sexologist Li Shiu Tong (李兆堂) from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Li Shiu Tong held by the Boston and Seattle field offices. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Li Shiu Tong. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Li Shiu Tong.

Please include a search of any records or documents understood to be, or colloquially referred to as "COINTELPRO records" under the bureau's custody that could be construed as responsive to a request for records related to Li Shiu Tong.

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or if certain portions must be redacted, please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for the bureau's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working together in having this request resolved. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Harlan Jay Ellison (May 27, 1934 – June 28, 2018)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into science fiction author Harlan Jay Ellison (May 27, 1934 – June 28, 2018). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/29/obituaries/harlan-ellison-intensely-prolific-science-fiction-writer-dies-at-84.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Copies of all Labor Standards Complaint Forms (LS223) filed by employees of businesses located in Delaware County, NY, since 1996, including companies owned and operated by parent companies in other regions of the United States and the world with facilities in Delaware County. title: Water Quality Complaints in Delaware County, NY

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Delaware County, NY
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Village of Hobart in the Town of Stamford in Delaware County for the period from January 1, 1996, to the present.

Specifically, I am seeking the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.

2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including:
2a. The date of the complaint
2b. The location (address or nearest cross streets) of the complaint
2c. The nature of the complaint (e.g., odor, taste, discoloration, contamination concerns)
2d. Any actions taken by your agency/authority/utility to address the complaint
2e. The resolution or current status of the complaint

3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

If any of this information is available in electronic format, I kindly request that you provide it via email. If physical copies are necessary, please inform me of any copying or postage fees in advance, and I will make arrangements for payment.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a detailed explanation for the denial and inform me of any appeal procedures available under New York State law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anne Elizabeth Moore

Brian

title: USAID Disaster Assistance Relief Team reports on Gaza

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USAID Disaster Assistance Relief Team reports on Gaza
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports from the USAID Disaster Assistance Relief Team to the U.S. State Department about the humanitarian situation in Gaza, between 6 May 2024 and the date this request is processed.

The news site KlipNews shared parts of a 28 August 2024 cable titled, "Gaza: IDF Evacuation Orders Repeatedly Displace Civilians and Aid Workers, Squeezing Limited Remaining Humanitarian Space." I am requesting this cable and others with the same subject matter. You may find the cable shared by KlipNews attached below or at the following link:  https://www.kenklippenstein.com/p/leaked-gaza-cable-us-military-in

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: INS/Inscape Seattle Landmarks Preservation Board commentary emails sent to sarah.sodt@seattle.gov

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: INS/Inscape Seattle Landmarks Preservation Board commentary emails sent to sarah.sodt@seattle.gov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails sent and received by the Sarah Sodt's email address of Sarah.sodt@seattle.gov related to deliberations on nominating the INS Building (aka "Inscape building") for landmark status. Limit the search to a time frame of May 1st 2024 and the date that this request is received. I believe that RCW Ch. 42.56 specifically makes these emails a public record. 

The public was urged to email Ms. Sodt. More information can be found here:
https://friendsofinscape.org/news/historic-seattle-landmarking
https://historicseattle.org/ins-building-inscape-landmark-nomination/

Thank you for the city of Seattle's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you on this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Pompeo Visit to Cairo
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All facturas, purchase orders, invoices, and similar documents originated by the American University in Cairo or the Department of State  (Secretary Pompeo and his team and President Francis Ricciardone and his team and executive assistant of the American University in Cairo (AUC)) intended to provide support (e.g., airfare, transport, food and hospitality, security for the event)for the visit to the American University in Cairo, Egypt on January 10, 2019 by Secretary Pompeo. Fiscal communications with or signed by Provost Ehab AbdelRahman (various spellings may be found), the controller at AUC, and Business Services of AUC are included in this request. 

Communications may have been via email (AUC's domain is @aucegypt.edu) but might have been via diplomatic pouch, State.gov email, etc.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Digital files preferred whenever possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Welcome to Smartsheet!
communications.communication:

communications.subject: Learn how
communications.communication:
Learn how to work in Smartsheet

Our webinar for Guest and Viewers is the fastest and easiest way to learn how to use Smartsheet

Play the webinar → https://go.smartsheet.com/dc/wIQmyGhXZM4DmbvAyzH4NeaUth_uka6AQkCT1l4R7nQhZTVQLm8jP7ntKdjTILw5IbmzXrtJ51ehPPDww9TJL0BQNeESXnf9LO0RRta0MHNEKmCSXofKQTcawFGiodF9fviRUou-rzuQXtDTZiMTfwPXxo4ddCRheUaqXGjMzNBFu6EgbQTrPLBr2rqy4GxEEpSRyQJqZmB66ZdWCQ-u-g==/NDY0LU9OTS0xNDkAAAGVU1sV56jR1ZmHopZ3as3OTEflieji-jFzwwPqMoezzEwGytfd4aSv3QhFiKtgeajuSxVUR5Q=

--

What is a Guest and Viewer?

There are three primary types of users in Smartsheet, all with unique capabilities. If you’d like to create your own work and have greater access you’ll need to upgrade to a free trial or be granted Member access by a System Admin.

PLATFORM ACCESS
- Guest & Viewer: Free on someone else’s paid plan
- Trial Users: Free for 30 days
- Member: Buy a subscription or license granted Member access by organization

KEEP THE ITEMS YOU CREATE
- Guest & Viewer: Requires upgrade for full capability
- Trial Users: Requires upgrade
- Member: Yes

VIEW, EDIT, AND SHARE SHEETS*
- Guest & Viewers: Included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

ATTACH DOCUMENTS*
- Guest & Viewer: Included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

COMMUNICATE WITH CONVERSATIONS AND PROOFING*
- Guest & Viewer: Included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

CREATE SHEETS, COLUMNS, AND FORMS
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

CREATE OR USE PRE-MADE TEMPLATES
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

CREATE DASHBOARDS, PORTALS, AND REPORTS
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

BUILD AUTOMATED WORKFLOWS
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

--

*Guests and Viewers with Internal Admin or Editor permissions have the same access. Users with Viewer permissions can only view.

--

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Tanya Lennon Fraud Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents related to fraud reports concerning Tanya Lennon (DOB: 10/15/1983) .

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon
